result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey A Wilde was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeffrey A Wilde is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeffrey A Wilde was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Remitted. $67 VW surcharge paid in full by bond.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Charles Andrew Ver Hoeve.  Awais Khaleel and Galen Strebe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dr. Laurent's report concludes defn is now compentent to proceed in these legal proceedings after treatment. Defn is agreement with the Dr.'s report and believes he is competent. Counsel do not have any evidence to bring to the contrary. CT finds the defn is now legally competent to proceed and these cases may proceed. CT orders defn to continue medications regardless of his consent. CT signs Order for Discharge of Commitment f/w.  CT orders body only BW vacated and 2/22/17 $500 cash bond reinstated.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Defendant in court with Attorney Charles Andrew Ver Hoeve.  Margaret Delain and Matthew Moeser appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jeffrey A Wilde in court with attorney Charles Andrew Ver Hoeve. Prosecuting Atty Margaret Delain and Atty Mathew Moeser appeared for State of Wisconsin. Competency report by Dr. Collins. Dr. Collins indicates in report that defn. is not competent at this time. Defn. agrees with report. State does not object to report findings either.  Ct. finds that defn. is not legally competent but will be able to be restored to competency within statutory time limit. Ct. orders defn. commited to outpatient competency restoration program.  Ct. will suspend proceedings.  Judge Aprahamian (Waukesha County) has requested copy of report from these cases for their cases. Defn. does not object to report being shared with Aprahamian. State Bail Motion filed 2-21-2017.  Atty Ver Hoeve indicates defn. does not object to modification of bail per the motion.  Ct. grants motion to amend bail to add condition of : Defendant will have no contact with Dane County District Attorney's office except through his attorney. All other conditions remain the same.
to Amend Bail Conditions(state's)

Competency hearing on February 22, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Charles Andrew Ver Hoeve.  Margaret Delain appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jeffrey A Wilde in court with attorney Charles Andrew Ver Hoeve. Prosecuting Atty Margaret Delain appeared for State of Wisconsin. Dr. Schoenecker's report indicates that defn. meets standards for legal competency. Defn. agrees to report of the doctor. ADA Delain requests a second evaluation and makes argument for such. ADA Delain indicates that defn. has been sending her letters non case related but personally related to ADA Delain that doctor did not have to help in evaluating defn. Ct. raises issue that defn. has been held in custody to have last evaluation.  Ct. reserves ruling on competency of defn.  Ct. grants request for 2nd opinion on competency evaluation as the court feels information ADA Delain can provide evaluator is new information that the 1st evaluator did not have.  Ct. orders 2nd opinion evaluation be done. Ct. orders defn to be released and original bond conditions put back in place.
Competency hearing on January 13, 2017 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Jeffrey A Wilde in court with attorney Adam M. Welch. Prosecuting Atty Pat Bomhack appeared for State of Wisconsin. Prel hrg held. Deputy Charles Wallace sworn & testified. Direct exam by ADA Bomhack. Witness identified defendant. Cross exam by Atty Welch. Witness excused. ADA Bomhack requests the court take judicial notice of the current bail in case #15CF404. Court made that finding. No further evidence. ADA Homback requests bindover and reserves rebuttal. Atty Welch requests the court dismiss the felony charge and made arguments. Rebuttal arguments by ADA Bomhack. Court finds probable cause that the defendant committed a felony and ordered him boundover for further proceedings.
